description: Calculate parabola properties including vertex, focus, directrix, axis of symmetry, and graph coordinates from the standard form equation y = ax² + bx + c.

sections.title: Parabola Equation Coefficients
sections.description: Enter the coefficients for the standard form equation y = ax² + bx + c

fields.name: a
fields.label: Coefficient a (quadratic term)

validation.message: Coefficient 'a' cannot be zero (would not be a parabola)

fields.helpText: The coefficient of x² in the equation y = ax² + bx + c (cannot be zero)

fields.name: b
fields.label: Coefficient b (linear term)

validation.message: Coefficient b must be a valid number

fields.helpText: The coefficient of x in the equation y = ax² + bx + c

fields.name: c
fields.label: Coefficient c (constant term)

validation.message: Coefficient c must be a valid number

fields.helpText: The constant term in the equation y = ax² + bx + c

outputs.name: vertexX
outputs.label: Vertex X-coordinate
outputs.description: The x-coordinate of the parabola's vertex

outputs.name: vertexY
outputs.label: Vertex Y-coordinate
outputs.description: The y-coordinate of the parabola's vertex

outputs.name: axisOfSymmetry
outputs.label: Axis of Symmetry
outputs.description: The equation of the axis of symmetry

outputs.name: focusX
outputs.label: Focus X-coordinate
outputs.description: The x-coordinate of the parabola's focus

outputs.name: focusY
outputs.label: Focus Y-coordinate
outputs.description: The y-coordinate of the parabola's focus

outputs.name: directrix
outputs.label: Directrix
outputs.description: The equation of the directrix line

outputs.name: opens
outputs.label: Opens
outputs.description: Direction the parabola opens (upward or downward)

examples.title: Basic Upward Parabola
examples.explanation: Vertex at (2, -1), opens upward, axis of symmetry x = 2

examples.title: Downward Opening Parabola
examples.explanation: Vertex at (1, 3), opens downward, axis of symmetry x = 1

examples.title: Parabola with No Linear Term
examples.explanation: Vertex at (0, 5), opens upward, axis of symmetry x = 0

seo.title: Parabola Calculator | Vertex, Focus, Directrix Calculator Online
seo.metaDescription: Calculate parabola properties including vertex, focus, directrix, and axis of symmetry from y = ax² + bx + c. Free online parabola calculator with step-by-step solutions.

howItWorks.title: How to Calculate Parabola Properties
howItWorks.description: A parabola is the graph of a quadratic function y = ax² + bx + c. Key properties include the vertex (turning point), focus, directrix, and axis of symmetry, all calculated using the coefficients a, b, and c.

variables.name: Quadratic coefficient
variables.description: Controls width and opening direction (a > 0: opens up, a < 0: opens down)

variables.name: Linear coefficient
variables.description: Affects the position of the axis of symmetry

useCases.title: Physics & Engineering
useCases.description: Model projectile motion, satellite orbits, and parabolic reflectors in engineering applications.

useCases.title: Architecture & Design
useCases.description: Design parabolic arches, bridges, and architectural elements with optimal structural properties.

useCases.title: Mathematics Education
useCases.description: Study quadratic functions, conic sections, and graphing techniques in algebra and precalculus.

useCases.title: Optimization Problems
useCases.description: Find maximum and minimum values in business, economics, and scientific applications.

tips: The vertex is the highest or lowest point on the parabola, depending on the sign of 'a'
If a > 0, the parabola opens upward and has a minimum value at the vertex
If a < 0, the parabola opens downward and has a maximum value at the vertex
The axis of symmetry always passes through the vertex: x = -b/(2a)
The focus and directrix are equidistant from any point on the parabola
The discriminant (b² - 4ac) determines the number of x-intercepts: positive = 2, zero = 1, negative = 0
